questions.question: What do relationships control in a semantic model?
questions.answer: How tables filter one another — they are core to correct, intuitive visuals.

questions.question: What is a disconnected table?
questions.answer: A table with no relationship to others. Perfect for What-If parameters (sliders, options).

questions.question: What are the requirements for a relationship between two tables?
questions.answer: Same data type, matching/overlapping values, and acts like a Primary Key → Foreign Key link.

questions.question: Name the four cardinality types.
questions.answer: 1↔1, 1↔Many (most common), Many↔1, Many↔Many (use sparingly).

questions.question: Which cardinality type is most common?
questions.answer: One-to-Many (1↔Many).

questions.question: What is the rule about active relationships between tables?
questions.answer: Only ONE active relationship path can exist between any two tables.

questions.question: How do you use an inactive relationship in DAX?
questions.answer: Use the USERELATIONSHIP() function to activate it within a measure.

questions.question: What are role-playing dimensions? Give an example.
questions.answer: When a table has multiple columns that could relate to the same dimension (e.g. OrderDate + ShipDate both linking to a Date table). Only one can be active; duplicate Date tables solve this.

questions.question: What is the recommended relationship direction and why?
questions.answer: Single direction — best for performance and clarity. Bi-directional should be used rarely as it can cause ambiguity.

questions.question: When might you use a bi-directional relationship?
questions.answer: Rarely — only when needed for specific filtering scenarios. It can cause ambiguity and performance issues.

questions.question: What are the three storage modes?
questions.answer: Import (data in memory), DirectQuery (queries source directly), and Dual (acts as both).

questions.question: Which storage mode gives the fastest performance?
questions.answer: Import — data is stored in memory for fastest query performance.

questions.question: What is DirectQuery and when would you use it?
questions.answer: Data is NOT stored locally — queries go directly to the source system. Use when data must be real-time or datasets are too large for import.

questions.question: What is Dual storage mode?
questions.answer: A table that acts as BOTH Import and DirectQuery. Used in composite models / star schemas for optimal performance.

questions.question: What is a Composite Model?
questions.answer: A model that mixes Import and DirectQuery tables together — a big modern BI capability.

questions.question: Name 3 places you can configure tables in Power BI.
questions.answer: The Ribbon, the Data Pane, and Model View (best for bulk edits).

questions.question: What should you ALWAYS do with Auto Date/Time?
questions.answer: Turn it OFF. Then create your own Date table and mark it as a Date Table.

questions.question: Why should you disable Auto Date/Time?
questions.answer: It creates hidden auto-generated date tables for every date column, bloating the model. A custom Date table is cleaner and more controllable.

questions.question: After creating a custom Date table, what must you do?
questions.answer: Mark it as a Date Table in the table properties.

questions.question: Why do data types matter in a semantic model?
questions.answer: Incorrect types break relationships, and impact performance and compression.

questions.question: Name 5 common data types in Power BI.
questions.answer: Whole Number, Decimal, Date/Time, Text, Boolean.

questions.question: What is the naming rule for columns?
questions.answer: Column names must be unique within their table. Use clear, meaningful names.

questions.question: Month names sort alphabetically. How do you fix this?
questions.answer: Add a Month Number column, then set Sort by Column on the month name column to sort by the number column.

questions.question: What are Data Categories and when are they required?
questions.answer: Metadata that describes column content. Required for Maps (Lat/Long). Useful categories include Image URL, Web URL, and Address.

questions.question: What should you set as the default summarisation for ID columns?
questions.answer: Don't Summarise — IDs should never be summed, averaged, etc.

questions.question: Name 4 default summarisation options.
questions.answer: Sum, Average, Min, Max (plus Don't Summarise and Count).

questions.question: What is the purpose of hierarchies?
questions.answer: Cleaner drill-down paths and better user experience in visuals.

questions.question: Give an example of a common hierarchy.
questions.answer: Year → Quarter → Month (date hierarchy).

questions.question: What are measures in DAX?
questions.answer: Calculated values that compute at query time — they are NOT stored in columns.

questions.question: What are Quick Measures?
questions.answer: Auto-generated DAX templates that help you create common measures without writing DAX manually.

questions.question: Name 4 properties you can set on a measure.
questions.answer: Description, Synonyms, Display Folders, and Hidden/Visible.

questions.question: What is the purpose of parameters?
questions.answer: Let users dynamically adjust report behaviour at runtime.

questions.question: What does a Numeric Range Parameter create?
questions.answer: A calculation table with Min/Max/Increment/Default values. Great for What-If analysis (e.g. tax rate slider).

questions.question: What do Fields Parameters allow users to do?
questions.answer: Choose fields dynamically — changing the Axis, Metrics, or Categories displayed in visuals.

questions.question: What does Row-Level Security (RLS) do?
questions.answer: Restricts which ROWS are visible to specific users. Can use static roles or dynamic roles (using USERNAME()).

questions.question: What is Column-Level Security (CLS)?
questions.answer: Hides sensitive COLUMNS from certain users. Less common than RLS but very useful for protecting sensitive data.

questions.question: What is the difference between static and dynamic RLS?
questions.answer: Static: hardcoded filter values in roles. Dynamic: uses USERNAME() or USERPRINCIPALNAME() to filter automatically based on who's logged in.

questions.question: Name 4 best practices for model cleanliness.
questions.answer: Hide unnecessary columns, use Display Folders, consistent naming conventions, and optionally place measures in a dedicated Measures table.

questions.question: What does 'Assume Referential Integrity' do?
questions.answer: Available in DirectQuery — improves performance by using INNER JOINs instead of OUTER JOINs, when you're confident source data is clean.

questions.question: What is a Star Schema and why is it preferred?
questions.answer: Fact tables in the middle, dimension tables around the outside. Gives clean relationships, fewer issues, and better performance.
